reviews.review: Bhopping with a story... 1337/10 would bhop again!
Классика.

[h1] Внизу обзор на оригинал, поиграйте лучше в него, данный "ремастеред" убьет все впечатление, лучше оригинал [/h1]

[h1] Прошел впервые 2015, поиграл в 2019, тащит до сих пор.[/h1]

Игра мне очень понравилась, да сейчас графика смотрится так себе, но это не главное. Не главное от слова совсем. В этой игре Valve заложили механики, которые используются до сих пор. Все вымерено насколько тонко и идеально,что прям хорошо. 

Сюжет
Да он есть, и самое прекрасное, что вы и есть сюжет. Тут нет киношных вставок (кроме одной), все остальное вы сами путешествуете и воссоздаете сюжет.  Если коротко, мы играем за молчаливого физика Гордона Фримана, который на научной станции Черная Меза участвует в эксперименте, как вы понимаете неудачно. Потусторонний мир прорывается к нам, и тут начинается экшен.

Графика
Даже сейчас, не смотря на угловатость, несмотря на старую морально графику, в игре можно провести и залипнуть не один вечер и перепройти её пару тройку раз. Она обладает атмосферой и это круто.

Геймплей
Не так уж прост, тут есть интересные механики. Но по сути это шутер, но эталонный.

Звук
Мне везде понравился. Жаль я не помню музыки.

Итог
Игра, которая прошла проверку временем. Для меня однозначно шедевр, и рекомендован к покупке и ознакомлению.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=879236373

Unlike the original Half-Life, which is in my opinion the best game of all time, Half-Life: Source is a buggy piece of shit with broken AI, broken hitboxes, sentences.txt written by an intellectually disabled dead squirrel, broken weapon recoil, shitty standard HL2 user interface, ear-rape inducing SteamPipe save-load freezing which often results in the game crashing, poor optimization, shitty (optional) HD weapon models that look like they were ripped straight from Gamebanana in 2002, broken multicore rendering which causes strange graphical glitches in certain areas of the game and it uses the shitty default Source 2K4 movement system and footstep sounds along with poorly implemented Half-Life 2 water textures and HL2 barrel models that don't fit with the rest of the game. It has no redeeming qualities whatsoever compared to the original game and it should be removed from the Steam store because it's just the same game with more bugs and better water.

every valve game every made has been unbeleivably awesome......Except this.  (in my opinion of course).   Half life is my favorite game of all time, period.  But this is just the same exact game in a different engine, and i actually prefer the classic look.  If you never played half life you will definitely enjoy this.  Only other situation recomendded would be if you buy half life complete, it comes with that, so its a nice little bonus.

Half-Life is one of the best and most influential fps games of the last few decades, and I think most would agree. Half-Life: Source is an update using Valve's source engine. While it's mostly the same, from level design, weapons, ect. there are minor differences such as updated water, better lighting and ragdolls. But this version has a lot more bugs than it's Goldsrc counterpart. Some that i came across were a floating scientist in the Anomalous Materials chapter, invisible barnacle tongues and the tentacle in Blast Pit not doing any damage (although that might not be a bug as I've heard that it was severely nerfed and can barely hit you). As for which version you should get for a first time player, it's kind of a toss-up. On one hand, Source looks slightly better, can be played in widescreen and has the updated water/lighting, but the original has much less bugs and has many more mods. It's really just up to you which you want. If you already have the original, though, there's not enough of anything new to justify a purchase. If you want a true source remake from the ground up, then buy BlackMesa.

im shocked frankly!
How did they fuck up a game i played so much as a teen!
back in the day when i was just a weeee little 13 year old, i used to pirate half life, 
after a while my grandparents bought me half life source and death match source, and i liked it, i got this game right around the time freeman's mind was coming out, 
the game was good i liked it, it was stable looked nice, and ran decently on my shitty hp pavilion slimline running vista, 
then my account got hacked and i lost the game, 
now year's later im 21 and decided to buy this game again to relive some old memories, 
i shouldn't have, this game has some how along the line gotten worse, what was once a decently put together game ported to the source engine is broken, 
so here are some good and bad additions, 
THEY FINALLY ADDED THE HD PACK! 
bad news, 
they added the HD pack. 
took them long enough but its worse than anything, textures look strange and inconsistent, the hev suite has wear on it, and so do all the armor on the barneys. 
Sounds are missing from various weapons when you turn it on, 
They never fixed the crow bar making one sound on every surface, (who knew it sounded like hitting a pipe on metal when you smack soft sand) 
There’s this strange inconsistent shiny texture i cant turn off, looking at freeman’s mind i dont see that, and i dont remember it, its annoying and only on specific parts of the gun, 
Ive made it as far as residue processing and ive just stoped. the strange shinny texture glitches here and splinter’s off, almost like how raggdols would noodle in fall out or world at war, they just shoot off and splinter across the map, and this covers the entire screen, 
The AI in areas is broken, head crabs wont lunge at you when you stand right in front of them, good thing for those who play on hard mode like me! 
Sounds all over break, sometimes they just dont play as if there’s not enough sound channels. 
Thats all i can name after spending a good portion of my day playing this game, 
There’s no reason to play this game, and almost no reason to buy it outside of garry’s mod assets, 
But hey, at least its on the source engine, and that makes it all better riiiiiiiiiight *just go buy black mesa already*

Is Half-Life truly the greatest game of all time? I can answer that question with one word.

No.

My friend had been pestering me for months to play this game. I had heard so many wonderful things about it, “It’s the greatest game of all time”, “It has an amazing story” are just two of the many great claims I’ve heard about this game. I’ve got to say, I’m extremely disappointed.

After launching the game, I’m greeted by some pretty abysmal graphics. The original game was released sometime around 1996, so poor graphics are to be expected in the original version of the game. What’s not to be expected is for there to be poor graphics in the remake/remaster of the game (Half-Life Source). If the graphics are this bad, I might have well just played the original version.

At first I put this aside; a game with bad graphics doesn’t always equal a bad game. I decided proceed through the “tutorial” area until I actually reach the real part of the game (in which you get your first weapon). I was quite frustrated to find out that I had to use a crowbar as a weapon, which in my opinion is quite a bad design decision. You are going to get a gun later in the game anyway, so why not just provide a gun earlier in the game? Another thing I can't work out is why did they put glasses on the main character? It doesn't seem very badass for the main character to wear glasses.

I then struggle to play though the game due to the dry story and boring combat mechanics. I honestly don’t know why everyone thinks the story to this game is so amazing. A science laboratory gets filled with aliens and you need to escape that laboratory. The story doesn’t get any more complicated or in-depth than that.

You also see a man in a suit from time to time. I don’t see the point in this since you never get the chance to fight him. He is clearly the bad guy in the game, but instead of fighting him at the end of the game, you just speak to him instead. What a disappointment.

Take my advice. Save your money and spend it elsewhere.

The only reason, the ONLY reason I am giving this game a negative recommendation, is because Black Mesa is now available on Steam.  Half-Life is a fantastic game, but this version of it is a sloppy port at best.  Save yourself the heartache of playing this version and go buy Black Mesa.  Black Mesa includes Trading Cards and Steam Achievements, which this version of Half-Life, sadly, does not.

Here's a link to Black Mesa, which is far worthier of your time:
http://store.steampowered.com/app/362890/

It has since come to my attention that the final levels are still not available in Black Mesa.  That was my mistake and I own that.  I still dislike this version of Half-Life.  If you REALLY want to experience the original Half-Life, I would say play the original game sans port.

Well, this game is very much the same as the original Half-Life game. All the qualities mentioned in my Half-Life Review more the most part still covers this game. Geometric lighting, very shiny metal surfaces and good-enough human AI graphics are all still there. 
Let me put it this way, if you already have Half-Life then don't get this game. You already have the game. I would be the same as having the original Star Wars episode 4 then buying the remastered version. Which brings me to the distaste of changing the special surprise ending to the original. I really didn't care for what it was changed out for. Otherwise, I would still recommend it, and recommend reading my review on Half-Life if given to serious consideration, yet still new to the game.  I question what all was fixed. I think I noticed one instinct where you could avoid an obstacle altogether, yet I still ran into a glitch that made it look like Freeman just got hit up on LSD (when looking up the surround blurred into an assortment of visuals overlapping for for a disorienting 70's tie design).

For my review of [b]Half-Life[/b], [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/AroNocebo/recommended/70/]check out my review of the original game[/url]. This is just a short insight on my thoughts of the Source version. 

[b]Half-Life: Source[/b] is simply the original [b]Half-Life[/b] ported to Valve's newer (at the time) Source engine, it doesn't bring anything new to the table aside from a few new menu options such as selecting a chapter, but it does improve a handful of aspects, mostly minor and technical. The most noteable changes are to the water, the ragdoll physics and the map lighting (in some cases). 

There are plenty of other minor things that you will notice after playing through once, it's like a new layer of polish, but nothing that would make me recommend buying this version over the original game as unfortunately the Source port has also caused a large number of bugs and errors to arise that were never in the original version. While some of the new features and mechanics in the Source engine are nice, the game hasn't really been updated to take those aspects into account, and thus, more problems popped up. 

So I have mixed feelings about [b]Half-Life: Source[/b], but I'd say that this version is worth playing through at least once if you are a Half-Life fan, it has a slightly different feel to it but ultimately I'd say to just stick to the original version of the game instead. It may be dated but that's what gives it it's charm.

Original review from 30 Jul, 2012 @ 12:58pm ---	 This is more of a comment; Half-Life Source is Half-Life upgraded onto the source engine and with some minimal graphic enchanments. There really is no difference between this and Half-Life other than chapter selecting, gmod compatibility, and source enging modding and editing etc. 

Edit:

With the current EA release of Black Mesa it made me think. A bunch of people on the BM forums are complaining about how it's a paid mod and all that junk, but really BM is a giant remastering, a complete overhaul built from the ground up in a whole new light, and yet Half-Life: Source still lingers around and has no real fresh thing about it other than it's simply on the source engine and there is no mod community for it at all.

People should be getting pissed off at this than BM, because this has more reason for it. If BM was released by Valve, or just suddenly popped up without anything previously knowing about it, it would have no hate whatsoever. 

Half-Life: Source should not be sold separately because it has nothing to it that's worth a full 10 dollar price tag on it's own. It should just be bundled and sold with the original Half-Life.

Un grande capolavoro del passato.
Semplicemente un must-have per gli amanti degli FPS, degli action e della loro storia. Gameplay semplice e infinitamente coinvolgente, una sfida costante sempre al limite delle munizioni e dell'energia. Lo stile inconfondibile e iconografico è reso  leggermente più godibile grazie alla grafica più leggibile del motore Source. Ci ricorda come deve essere un vero gioco d'azione, e ci fa rendere conto di come i giochi più recenti ci abbiano abituato (male?) all'imediatezza e alla facilità.

如果说这是半条命1.5的话，确实有点对不起广大玩家，因为这根本就不是半条命初代复刻版。
我购买的是Half-Life Complete，因此自带了这个版本，当时我以为是基于HL2引擎下的HD化游戏，可是最后我进入后就是无尽的失望——
这是一个原封不动的半条命1，甚至建模都与半条命初代完全一致，唯一的不同就是将一堆HL1的素材塞进了Source引擎，然后以Source引擎的物理效果和光影呈现一个HL1，除此之外没有区别——实际上，如果要玩的话，完全可以玩HL1基于QUAKE引擎的那个版本，因为除了一些无关紧要的光影和物理效果，你根本就无法察觉到有什么不同。况且很多人不会直接买HL:S，因此基本上这都是与HL1捆绑在一起的，那么我为什么要重复地玩两遍几乎没有区别的游戏呢？仅仅是为了看看Source引擎的效果？如果这是在2004年6月至11月之间还情有可原，因为HL2尚未发售，那么我们可以说HL:S是一个技术演示，可是仅仅只是拿来尝鲜5个月（这种复刻甚至根本不能算做尝鲜），之后.....想体验Source引擎，我去玩HL2好不好？

如果说这部作品有什么优点的话，也许就是过场动画的某些字幕不再是英语了，但是这几乎可以被无视，并且在相当长的一段时间里，这款游戏的中文（简体/繁体）居然套用了英语语音，而且这款游戏不像之后的Source引擎游戏具有全程字幕，与当年的HL1一样，如果语音不是本国语言的话你就要硬着头皮去完全地”听译“，VALVE甚至懒得给这款复刻作品多加个字幕.....直到2014年的某一次更新，才和HL1一样将语言换回了国语配音。

因此，如果VALVE将HL1抛弃QUAKE引擎直接升级到Source引擎，也许玩家们给的或许都是”赞“，但是现状就是，HL1依然在热火朝天的卖着，而你依然要花费9.99$（似乎也没有任何优惠）去买一个完全一致的作品，因此，如果你没有HL1，那么可以直接购买HL:S，体验Source引擎下的HL，但是如果你是买的HL1，请不要再花这冤枉钱了.....


题外话，如果Black Mesa:Source能够尽早上市，那么这款游戏几乎就可以压箱底了....他已经失去了最后的价值。。。。

I've never played the original half life, and all my friends have been telling me to play it, but primarily the source version. It looks just as good as the original game (I know this because ive seen youtube videos of the non-source version) A lot of action, and a little bit of Sci-fi horror, combined with awesome graphics for its time and updated to have ragdoll physics and updated sounds.

The only reason that I got this is because I'm a diehard Half-Life fan. There is practically no reason to get this if you already have the original game. The only difference is the ragdoll and water effects, nothing more. Also, there is an enormous amount of bugs and glitches in this game. And there is no modding support either. 

If you want to get a FAR better remake of the classic game, get Black Mesa.
Face it, this game is so much better than Half-Life 2.

It's [i]Half-Life[/i] with some of [i]Half-Life 2[/i]'s graphic features. The most notable (but not the only ones) are the transparent water, ragdolled models (and now your shots cause wounds on their skin, cool), and the lighting.

I think other things were modified too, beside graphics. I noted changes in AI, enemy attributes, weapons and maps.

There are some weird bugs, but they don't compromise the experience. So play [i]Half-Life: Source[/i] if you can, but keep the original one around.

But I stll have the original anyway. I have come across a few bugs, like the crowbar texture and some officeners wont open the door when I need them too. Still a fantastic game though.
Just go download Black Mesa...

Ah Half life, possible one of my favorite game and game series of all time. I decided to pick up the old half life and try playing through it again on hard mode and it was quite a challenge for me, but a fun one nonetheless. If you have not played this game yet and are considering buying it, ask yourself this: Do i like shooters? Do i lke survival horror shooters? Do i enjoy a game with fast paced action, linear movement of story, easter eggs, fun, and a game that is just so good that i cant possibly resist playing it? If you answered yes to any of those questions then this game is right for you. A word of advice though, this is the source version so while osme textures are improved there are an abundance of bugs, glitches, and new errors. if your willing to look past all that (which is easy to do) then buy this version. If not then just buy the original half life. Either way I highly recommend this game as it is easily a lifetime classic.

There are legions of fans all over the Internet praising this game left and right for its innovative approach to telling a story in an FPS setting. I'll concede that point, but I'll also say that an FPS is mostly about gameplay and immersion, not about story. The gameplay in this game is pretty atrocious, because a lot of it involves jumping puzzles.

Jumping puzzles, with rare exception, DO NOT WORK in an FPS. They don't. They. DON'T. If you make a jump in real life, you have a bunch of senses other than sight helping you land where you want to land. In an FPS, you've got limited sight and none of the other senses. Now I was going to give this game a pass, since it came out early on and maybe the developers simply didn't get this as they were breaking new ground in the FPS genre. But then I read that the sequel also has jumping puzzles, so they clearly didn't learn their lesson.

A second flaw is the "realism" of the game. You fight a branch of the military at several points and they'll set up ambushes or minefields in which you don't see either of them coming. You need to navigate a minefield completely blind, which is realistic, but let's consider the fact that a theoretical physicist with little to no combat training fighting hordes of aliens and the military, in reality, is going to get his bullet-ridden ass handed to him in approximately 12 seconds. You pretty much need to abuse save/load to get through this game, which isn't fun at all.

And what the flaming hell was up with losing all your equipment halfway through the game? That served exactly no purpose at all except to piss the player off. Really? The soldiers set up an ambush, like all the other ambushes Freeman had no trouble getting through, but this time they turned off the lights! Gasp! So much for realism and storytelling.

Yeah, I'm not playing the sequel or the sequel to the sequel.

Despite what the autists in the review slot say. This is a more polished HL which feels alot closer to how it was intended.
